content: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Albert Einstein
content: Laws alone can not secure freedom of expression; in order that every man present his views without penalty there must be spirit of tolerance in the entire population.
None knows the weight of another's burden.
author: George Herbert

content: What is past is left behind. The future is yet unreached. Whatever quality is present, clearly see it right there.
author: The Buddha

content: The best way out is always through.
author: Robert Frost

content: Take things as they are. Punch when you have to punch. Kick when you have to kick.
author: Bruce Lee

content: We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
author: Albert Schweitzer

content: All that is necessary is to accept the impossible, do without the indispensable, and bear the intolerable.
author: Kathleen Norris

content: Always be smarter than the people who hire you.
author: Lena Horne

content: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
author: Isocrates

content: To accomplish great things, we must dream as well as act.
author: Anatole France

content: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
author: Samuel Johnson

content: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.
author: Demosthenes

content: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

content: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

content: No man was ever wise by chance.
author: Seneca the Younger

content: Silence is the true friend that never betrays.
author: Confucius

content: Do not mind anything that anyone tells you about anyone else. Judge everyone and everything for yourself.
author: Henry James

content: We've got to have a dream if we are going to make a dream come true.
author: Walt Disney

content: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.
author: Cicero

content: Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: By letting it go it all gets done. The world is won by those who let it go. But when you try and try. The world is beyond the winning.
author: Laozi

content: Anyone who doesn't take truth seriously in small matters cannot be trusted in large ones either.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Life is the only real counselor; wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.
author: Edith Wharton

content: To effectively communicate, we must realize that we are all different in the way we perceive the world and use this understanding as a guide to our communication with others.
author: Tony Robbins

content: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
author: Montesquieu

content: Our kindness may be the most persuasive argument for that which we believe.
author: Gordon Hinckley

content: There are two ways to slide easily through life: to believe everything or to doubt everything; both ways save us from thinking.
author: Alfred Korzybski

content: Living at risk is jumping off the cliff and building your wings on the way down.
author: Ray Bradbury

content: Anything you really want, you can attain, if you really go after it.
author: Wayne Dyer
Michael Jordan
content: I've missed more than 9000 shots in my career. I've lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I've been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I've failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.
author: Henry van Dyke Jr.

content: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
author: Robert Southey

content: Imagination rules the world.
author: Napoleon

content: The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are.
author: John Burroughs

content: It is through science that we prove, but through intuition that we discover.
author: Henri Poincaré

content: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
author: Albert Schweitzer

content: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

content: Humanity is acquiring all the right technology for all the wrong reasons.
author: Buckminster Fuller

content: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: All the great performers I have worked with are fueled by a personal dream.
author: John Eliot

content: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.
author: Epictetus

content: At the center of your being, you have the answer; you know who you are, and you know what you want.
author: Laozi

content: The problem with Google is you have 360 degrees of omnidirectional information on a linear basis, but the algorithms for irony and ambiguity are not there. And those are the algorithms of wisdom.
author: William Hurt

content: Arriving at one point is the starting point to another.
author: John Dewey
Abraham Lincoln
content: I am a firm believer in the people. If given the truth, they can be depended upon to meet any national crisis. The great point is to bring them the real facts.
Appreciation can make a day, even change a life. Your willingness to put it into words is all that is necessary.
author: Margaret Cousins

content: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen, nor touched... but are felt in the heart.
author: Helen Keller
